means: 对…起平衡作用，抵消( counterbalance的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: But with time and counterbalancing financial measures, this obstacle can be overcome.
sentence.Network_cn: 但随着时间的推移,以及采取制衡的财政措施, 这个障碍是可以克服的.

sentence.Network_en: These verbs mean to make something ineffective by if by applying an opposite or counterbalancing force.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些动词是指通过使用相反的或制衡的力量使事物无效.

sentence.Network_en: However , counterbalancing the free nature of, and many contributors to, Wikipedia is the issue of quality.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而, 维基百科是品质文献,这抵消和妨碍了其自由的天性和广泛的贡献者参与.

entry.tran: 对…起平衡作用;抗衡;抵消
entry.def: To counterbalance something means to balance or correct it with something that has an equal but opposite effect.

example.ex: Add honey to counterbalance the acidity...
His patriarchal generosity is counterbalanced by his ruthlessness.
example.tran: 他有着族长式的慷慨大方，同时却又冷漠无情。

entry.tran: 起平衡作用的事物;抗衡力；抵消因素
entry.def: Something that is a counterbalance to something else counter-balances that thing.

example.ex: ...organisations set up as a counterbalance to groups allied to the ANC.
example.tran: 为抗衡非国大联盟而成立的一些组织

auth_sentence.content: Magnets are remarkable exemplars of fairness every north pole is invariably accompanied by a counterbalancing south pole.

auth_sentence.content: To date the only counterbalancing force to this is the collective hue and cry of the public over what we are giving up.
